title: Who is the one person you can't live without? - Quora

response.answer_text: There used to be. I was partnered to a man named Jerry for 13 years. It was a dysfunctional relationship in a number of ways, but it also worked. Our lives became so intertwined that I couldn’t imagine getting along without him. The thought that it might end scared me, I didn’t think I could manage. As time went on, there was more negativity, as we had issues which we weren’t addressing, and they just got worse. Finally I came to the conclusion that I had to leave, because I was losing myself in the relationship. I had compromised so much of what I wanted, how I felt, and what I believed, I was losing all sense of myself as an individual. I put up with so much mistreatment & bad behavior, because I was afraid to leave. With a few year’s counseling, I finally made a plan to leave. I had intended to sit Jerry down & explain why I was leaving, allowing him to have his say as well, but in the end I chickened out. I knew, if he asked me to stay, I wouldn’t have the strength to say no. And I knew him-he’d promise to change, possibly even get counseling himself to deal with his issues. Things would be better for a time, then we’d slide back into our old patterns of interaction. He hated change, and said all the time that he couldn’t change if he wanted to. you don’t just get rid of something like that with therapy. In the end I told him I was going to spend some time helping out my aging parents (giving me an excuse to bring all the stuff i use every day, instead just a few changes of clothes) and got my brother to bring me back to our parents’ home. i still wasn’t 100% sure I was leaving for good, but it was definitely on my mind. Once at home, and had the support of my family, I decided I was done and wasn’t going back. I was actually coward enough to break up with him via Facebook messager! I regret that to this day. If somebody did that to me I’d probably never forgive them. Well, life has a way of putting a twist into every story. Almost exactly a year after I left, Jerry died of lung cancer. He had been diagnosed 2 weeks prior, it was very advanced (he hated doctors & never went unless it couldn’t be avoided) & he didn’t have much chance of survival at that point. I’d seen him a couple times since leaving, when i came back to get the rest of my stuff. You could feel the hostility coming off of him in waves. Again, totally understandable considering the circumstances. I just hate that it ended that way, I wish we’d gotten some resolution & closure. Now it will never happen. I still grieve for him, and I’m sure I always will. You just don’t spend that many years with somebody without them becoming a part of you.

I have been travelling the journey of loss since 2015 and when I first read your question, my first thought was… my son. He died at 18 years old in a vehicle collision and never came home after that night. My heart was shattered and I remember the statements I made… “No!!! I don’t want to be a Mom who had a child that died!” Here I am, going into my 5th year without my only son and somehow I have survived. Does it still hurt? ABSOLUTELY! There isn’t a day that goes by that I don’t speak or acknowledge my son in some way… but it’s different now. My entire belief system has been revamped and things I never even considered years ago, are now part of my daily thoughts. I believe we go on after this lifetime. I have had so many signs from my son and heard others share the same stories. I may have thought I could never live without my son in the beginning of this tragedy but now I know I don’t have to. He’s with me any time I need him. I can feel his presence when he’s near; a shift in the energy. He is not gone. He has only moved on to the next phase of his journey, wherever that realm happens to reside and one day, I will go to where he is too. If you’re interested in reading about all the signs I received during the first year after my son passed, I documented everything. You can find Butterfly Kisses From Beyond - Signs From My Son in Heaven on Amazon.  https://www.amazon.com/Kim-Halerwich-Clark/e/B00DYBAH1Y?ref=sr_ntt_srch_lnk_2&qid=1580407588&sr=8-2
